channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: SARAH VINE: With women in charge, hair salons would be the first businesses to open
item.description: SARAH VINE: The Government has decreed that from June 15, Britain will once again be a nation of shopkeepers. But I fear there may be a slight fly in the ointment. In a word: hairdressers.

item.title: The best-selling $48 blush that celebrities and makeup experts can't get enough of
item.description: Celebrities and makeup artists continue to rave about a $48 blush that has become a 'cult-favourite' due to its stand-out name and natural rosy colour.

item.title: Family of black man George Floyd says firing of four cops is a start and calls for their prosecution
item.description: George Floyd's heartbroken family have broken their silence and told how they watched the horrific footage on TV before realizing it was their 'baby cousin'.

item.title: RNLI calls for beaches without lifeguards to be shut after two deaths
item.description: West Wittering beach in West Sussex is opening for the first time since being shut more than two months ago on March 21 after it faced huge crowds before the lockdown was implemented days later.

item.title: Online casino plied 25-year-old with a £400 booster just hours before he took his own life
item.description: A high-flying engineer killed himself hours after an online casino 'groomed' him with £400 in cash bonuses. Chris Bruney, 25, lost a total of £119,000 in the five days before his death.

item.title: Katy Perry puts her baby bump on full display as she hits the beach with fiancé Orlando Bloom
item.description: Exclusive DailyMail.com photos show Katy Perry heading to the beach in California with fiancé Orlando Bloom this weekend.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: MHR tells labs to STOP analysing home tests
item.description: The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has stopped laboratories from processing privately-bought antibody tests, MailOnline understands.

item.title: More than 60% of people joining extremist groups on Facebook had the pages recommended by algorithms
item.description: Research at the social media giant unearthed a worrying trend linking the platform's recommendations to extremist views on the site.

item.title: The seven moves everyone who works from home should be doing every day
item.description: A leading sports scientist who has worked with Olympians and NRL players has revealed the seven moves everyone who works from home should be doing every day to stay fit and healthy.

item.title: Some 750,000 MOTs carried out in April despite lockdown
item.description: Motorists were urged to not use their cars as part of stricter lockdown rules in April, with only front-line and essential workers allowed to continue driving and have vehicles MOT tested.

item.title: Boris Johnson tells WHO chief: There MUST be an inquiry into the origins of coronavirus
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson made the comments in a call to the World Health Organisation (WHO) boss Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday, Downing Street said.

item.title: Huawei kit will stay inside part of Britain's mobile phone network for SEVEN YEARS, experts say
item.description: Industry insiders said last night that it would take between five and seven years for them to rip out Huawei kit from their infrastructure if they were told to do so by the UK Government.

item.title: Chimps smack their lips together to talk to each other
item.description: Primatologists from the universities of Warwick and St Andrew's found that chimpanzees move their lips two to five times a second, while humans do this only two to seven times a second.

item.title: Tricky geography quiz will put your knowledge to the test - so can YOU achieve a perfect score?
item.description: The challenging quiz was created by Michael Rogers for US-based trivia site Playbuzz. It is compiled of 16 questions to 'prove you truly are a geek' by testing your knowledge of geography.

item.title: Why you're losing hair in isolation
item.description: Thousands of Australian men and women have reported suffering hair loss while at home during the virus pandemic - and now experts have revealed exactly why this is.

item.title: WHO official warns coronavirus is not defeated and Europe must brace for a deadly second wave
item.description: Dr Hans Kluge, European director for the World Health Organisation, has claimed that the pandemic is not over and countries should use the next few months 'for preparation, not celebration'.

item.title: Tourist board announces bold new plan to draw visitors to Japan after the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: The Japanese Government has announced an $18.2 billion campaign that will offset travel costs for visitors.

item.title: First time buyer reveals how she's transformed a drab 1960s home into an ultra-modern pad
item.description: Rosie Potter and Jacob Flurry from Bristol, had no plans to buy until they spotted 1960s Twin Trees. After realising it was still on the market months after they viewed it, they put in a 'cheeky' offer.

item.title: Families and friends could soon be allowed to meet in bigger 'social bubbles' of up to ten people
item.description: Barbecues and garden parties could also be among activities given the go-ahead in Britain by the end of June after being raised in the Cabinet.

item.title: 'Aggressive' shopper who left carer in tears is an ICU nurse on coronavirus frontline
item.description: Marina Kendrick, 53, told friends that she had been enforcing the 'nursing code' and could not believe the backlash against her after the incident in Burton-upon-Trent.

item.title: Creative mum transforms her tired-looking for £112 - using floor stickers from Homebase and
item.description: Yianoula Griffiths, 36, from Berkshire, told how she transformed her bathroom during lockdown for just £112 - using flooring from Homebase, a new blind from Argos and paint that she already had.

item.title: Dominic Cummings added mention of coronavirus into a year-old blog post just weeks ago
item.description: The PM's special adviser said on Monday at a Downing Street press conference that he had written about the 'urgent need for planning' for a coronavirus pandemic in 2019.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Whole towns could face 'local lockdowns'
item.description: The Health Secretary said the ability to tighten restrictions in individual regions will be part of the NHS test, track and trace system - which is set to expand on June 1.

item.title: Chancellor Rishi Sunak 'will stop firms furloughing more staff from August'
item.description: The Chancellor will this week lay out the second stage of his plans to help businesses come off Government financial support and get the country 'back up and running'.

item.title: Holiday refund hopes grounded as airlines plan to restart flights
item.description: A raft of UK carriers have now said they plan to resume summer routes despite government advice against foreign holidays and plans to quarantine travellers for two weeks.

item.title: Rhys Jones's killer Sean Mercer is pictured for the first time since he was jailed
item.description: Sean Mercer, now 29, has been messaging a woman from within his cell after liking one of her comments on Instagram, according to reports. Mercer was jailed for shooting Rhy Jones, 11, in Liverpool in 2007.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces a grilling from senior MPs today with Covid questions squeezed into 20 mins
item.description: Downing Street is facing anger from various sections of the Tory Party over its handling of the row with many MPs telling the Prime Minister that Cummings has to go.

item.title: Bird-watcher 'unsure how he feels' about firing of white investment banker dubbed Central Park Karen
item.description: Christian Cooper said Tuesday about his encounter with Amy in New York: 'Where she went was a racist place. That action was racist. Does that make her a racist? I can't answer that.'

item.title: Trump adviser says China making 'big mistake' on Hong Kong
item.description: President Donald Trump leveled a new threat at China as it seeks to impose new law on Hong Kong, saying the island's status as a financial hub could be put in jeopardy.

item.title: YouTube says glitch in moderation system responsible deleted comments criticizing Chinese government
item.description: The platform says that the deletion of the critical comments was apparently caused by an alleged bug in its automatic moderation algorithm and is currently being investigated, according to The Verge.

item.title: Motorola may release foldable Razr after screen issues with first
item.description: News that Motorola may be planning a second Razr phone for release before the end of the year comes from a general manager with the technology company, Lenovo, who spoke on a podcast.

item.title: Wedding video company tells man whose fiancée died in a car crash 'life's a bitch' and deny refund
item.description: Justin Montney's 22-year-old Alexis-Athena Wyatt died in a car crash February 4 and Copper Stallion Media has shown harsh retaliation against the Colorado man after he left negative reviews.

item.title: Cyclist is left bloodied and bruised after smashing into wire booby trap
item.description: Neil Nunnerley, 47, was riding on a path in Cardiff shortly before 3pm on Saturday. He hit a barrier made of wire and branches that was stretched across the trail.

item.title: Andrea Bocelli secretly battled COVID-19 in MARCH and is donating his blood to help with vaccine
item.description: Andrea Bocelli has revealed he and members of his family are COVID-19 survivors.

item.title: This is what 25 years worth of stockpiling looks like
item.description: She said 'bulk buying' has saved her family of 10 from incalculable stress during natural disasters like the Queensland floods of 2010 and emergencies like the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Dominic Cummings' eyesight
item.description: 'Come on, Mr Cummings, have another go at reading the bottom line'

item.title: Disabled man and his able-bodied fiancee discuss their sex life
item.description: Shane Burcaw, 27, and Hannah Aylward, 24, revealed how they manage intimacy in their latest video shared on their Squirmy and Grubs' YouTube channel.

item.title: 55% of Tory voters say Dominic Cummings should resign over his 'lockdown breach'
item.description: Dominic Cummings is under intense pressure to quit his role as Boris Johnson's top aide after driving 260 miles from London to Durham with his family at the height of coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Six Cabinet members 'privately believe Dominic Cummings should resign'
item.description: Six Cabinet members are believed to have privately told colleagues that Dominic Cummings should quit, while at least 40 Tory MPs have demanded his resignation.

item.title: Christopher Stevens reviews A House Through Time and last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Of all the houses that Lefty British-Nigerian historian David Olusoga could have picked to illustrate Bristol's past, he chose one steeped in slavery.
item.media:credit: BBC / Twenty Twenty Ltd. / Mark Bourdillon

item.title: Priti Patel wants new powers to curb illegal migrants sneaking into UK and calls for law change
item.description: The Home Secretary has told Border Force chiefs to examine whether they have the legal authority to turn migrant boats around in the Channel - and send them back to France.

item.title: Simon Cowell 'donates his £1million fee from Marks & Spencer advert to children's charity'
item.description: The talent show mogul, 60, is said to have asked the retailer to support Together For Short Lives over the next year with his commercial cheque.

item.title: Doctor and nurse get married at the hospital where they work
item.description: Jann Tipping, 34, and Annalan Navaratnam, 30, tied the knot in the Grade II listed chapel at London's St Thomas' Hospital. Guests enjoyed their special day remotely as a witness live-streamed it.

item.title: Coronavirus Italy: American couple FINALLY get Pompeii tour
item.description: Colleen and Marvin Hewson, retirees from Michigan, were first in line when the archaeological site reopened to the public today following Italy's coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Trump is 'fact-checked' by Twitter over 'misleading' claim mail-in ballots will lead to fraud
item.description: President Trump escalated his claims Tuesday that California's mail-in ballots will lead to substantial voter fraud in the November general election.

item.title: Another 80 migrants are picked up in SEVEN boats
item.description: Around 65 migrants had arrived on six vessels by 10am after mainly setting off from Gravelines, 16 miles east of Calais. Another 15 arrived an hour later, with one man even travelling in a kayak.

item.title: How to spice up your diet! Try these deliciously healthy recipes from the Hairy Bikers
item.description: As statistics reveal a higher mortality rate from coronavirus for those who are obese or have type 2 diabetes, Si King and Dave Myers reveal how their new cookbook may help save yours...

item.title: Police break up 'lockdown-breaching 40th birthday party' at home of Welsh Tory MP
item.description: Police attended the home of Conservative MP Rob Roberts, who represents the constituency of Delyn in North Wales, after reports of a birthday party taking place. Mr Roberts was in London at the time.

item.title: Dentists are told to plan for treating patients again 'in three weeks'
item.description: The Government is facing calls for England's dentists to be a part of the second phase of lifting lockdown. If this goes ahead, dental surgeries would reopen alongside shops on June 15.

item.title: RICHARD HENRIQUES tells the chilling story of how 21 Chinese cockle pickers lost their lives
item.description: Sir Richard Henriques, one of Britain's most distinguished lawyers, relives the trial of the Chinese gangmaster and his accomplices whose greed cost the lives of 21 cockle-pickers.

item.title: Morecambe and Motherwell pay tribute to Christian Mbulu after defender dies aged 23
item.description: The former Millwall player joined League Two Morecambe in January following his release from Crewe Alexandra and the club paid tribute to him following news of his sudden passing.

item.title: Premier League want September start for next season irrespective of when current campaign finishes
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The Premier League will tell clubs that they want next season to start on the weekend of September 12-13 irrespective of the conclusion to the current campaign.

item.title: British ticketholder wins tonight's EuroMillions jackpot but must share with a French player
item.description: Camelot said tonight the £33million jackpot prize will be split between two EuroMillions players, one in France and one in England - with both pocketing £16.million.

item.title: Google will start start reopening offices at 10% capacity in July
item.description: On Tuesday Google CEO Sundar Pichai said offices will start to open at roughly 10% capacity starting in July and ramp up to 30% by September in some cities.

item.title: Face masks and latex gloves are found strewn along a French seabed
item.description: French NGO Operation Clean Sea had been working to clean up the ocean floor around Antibes in southeastern France when they stumbled on a mass of coronavirus-related waste.

item.title: Microplastics shed from tyres are a major source of river and ocean pollution, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Plymouth have revealed the significant contribution of tyre particles to plastic pollution, which can reach the ocean directly via the atmosphere, or in run-off, rivers and sewers.

item.title: People are more likely to gamble after losing, study finds
item.description: People gamble faster after losing than winning, according to psychologists in Europe, as part of a syndrome called 'post-loss speeding' that may be linked with other addictive behaviours.

item.title: Greggs will reopen around 800 stores from mid-June
item.description: The bakery chain is expected to begin serving customers in mid-June, after it successfully trialled the reopening of a dozen stores in the North East earlier this month.

item.title: Britain could soon be carrying out a MILLION coronavirus tests every day
item.description: New technology - if approved - could allow routine monthly testing of every household in Britain. Documents reveal the NHS is in early talks over the tests, which cost less than £2.50 each.

item.title: Georgia woman, brother OK after turtle strikes car window
item.description: Latonya Lark said she was driving down Harry S. Truman Parkway near Montgomery Cross Roa in Savannah this month when she saw the object.

item.title: Disney and CBS sued for 'disregarding sexual assault claims against Criminal Minds cinematographer'
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in Los Angeles County yesterday, claims that over a period of 14 years, director of photography for the series, Gregory St. Johns, 'used his position' to frequently sexually assault crew.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Kirstie Allsopp fears lockdown has turned UK into a land of snoopers
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: No one knows better than Kirstie Allsopp an Englishman's home is his castle, but the property queen says lockdown is turning us into curtain-twitchers.

item.title: Househunting surge will be short-lived, warns Zoopla
item.description: Zoopla also warned that four in ten buyers were now shelving their plans because of market uncertainty, loss of income or diminished confidence in their future finances.

item.title: Bloodbath of bankers in HSBC's biggest shake-up in 155 years
item.description: The bank had already announced it was axing 35,000 posts this year. But due to the pandemic, the lender now thinks its overhaul may need to be even more radical.

item.title: Redditors share worst 'food sins' they've ever seen, including tuna fish and jelly sandwiches
item.description: Redditors are sharing the worst 'food sins' they've ever seen, the unholy and questionably edible dishes they've either consumed themselves or watched another person eat.

item.title: Skin experts reveal why face masks are causing acne - and how to treat it
item.description: Several social media users - especially medical workers who wear masks all day - have shared images of their mask-induced acne.

item.title: JEANETTE KUPFERMANN was astonished when her university boyfriend got in touch to say he loved her
item.description: JEANETTE KUPFERMANN: This was no casual catching up either. My old flame was swearing eternal devotion to me. Who in their late-70s receives declarations of love out of the blue?

item.title: Meghan Markle's 'rift' with Kate Middleton 'was caused by clash over tights', Tadler reports
item.description: Society bible Tatler has detailed the alleged fall-out between Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle in a profile of Kate, 38, in its latest issue which is available from tomorrow.

item.title: Konnie Huq claims being seen as the 'token' Asian woman on Blue Peter helped pave the way for others
item.description: The former Blue Peter presenter, 44, is the longest-serving female host, surpassing Valerie Singleton with an 11-year stint from 1997 to 2008, and discussed her time on the show on Tuesday.

item.title: NSA's tracking program FAR more extensive than thought
item.description: Journalist Barton Gellman describes how the tool at the heart of the NSA's phone-tracking surveillance program works in unprecedented detail in his new book, Dark Mirror.

item.title: Read our exclusive extract from JK Rowling's new fairytale The Ickabog
item.description: Harry Potter author J K Rowling's new children's book The Ickabog is said to be for 'children on lockdown, or even those back at school during these strange, unsettling times'.

item.title: Body of autistic boy, 9, 'twice pushed into Florida canal by his mother had signs of head trauma'
item.description: Patricia Ripley, 45, right, is facing attempted and premeditated murder charges. Her son Alejandro Ripley, left, was found floating in a Miami, Florida, canal on Friday.

item.title: Have you been left short changed by government pension blunders?
item.description: Campaigners are calling for the Department for Work and Pensions to conduct a full investigation into how many women have missed out on their pensions and how it was allowed to happen.

item.title: ASK TONY: How did my £3,454 cheque with Halifax vanish into thin air?
item.description: I went into my Halifax branch and asked for a cheque for €4,000 to be raised and paid to a third party. The cheque was never received and the money has not been credited back.

item.title: Insurers still refusing to pay out on Covid policies
item.description: Tens of thousands of firms face bankruptcy having been denied payouts, despite years of paying for policies that promised to provide protection against outbreaks of a 'human contagious disease'.

item.title: Scientists say 5,800 square miles of Louisiana wetlands could disappear within 50 years
item.description: A new study of the Louisiana marshlands outside New Orleans says the region has already passed its tipping point and could be completely submerged within 50 years.

item.title: Cancelled Glastonbury Festival honoured by BBC showing sets
item.description: The music event's 50th anniversary was cancelled in March due to the global COVID-19 crisis and postponed until June 2021. It was due to take place from June 24-28.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Police probe 300-person Peterborough rave
item.description: More than a dozen officers rushed to the lockdown-defying party in Paston, Peterborough, last night, where they found hundreds 'intoxicated' party-goers gathered in the street.

item.title: Police officers' son who killed two men in crash escapes probe
item.description: Max Coopey, 18, killed father-of-three Jason Imi, 48, and his colleague John Shackley, 61, as they were walking back from dinner in Ascot, Berkshire late at night in August 2018.

item.title: Virginia dog believed to have longest nose in the world
item.description: Eris is a large-nosed borzoi, a breed that is known for its longer snouts, however the two-year-old pup has a particularly long nose.

item.title: Father, 26, who tricked his way into a terrified pensioner's flat is jailed
item.description: Maron Gebru, 26, twice sneaked into a block of flats in Smethwick, Birmingham, where the 74-year-old woman lived alone in August 2017.

item.title: India yogi who claimed to live without food or water dies at 90
item.description: An Indian yoga master whose claims he spent decades without food or water earned him a band of devotees and the scepticism of doctors has died.
item.media:description: Prahlad Jani, who claimed he lived without food or water, in a photo taken on May 6, 2010

item.title: Prince Charles says composition for his grandmother reflected her 'smile, love and sense of duty'
item.description: The Prince of Wales, 71, who is currently at Birkhall, said the piece - by Nigel Hess and first performed in 2007 - is 'very dear to my heart' when speaking on his second show for Classic FM.

item.title: Istanbul's Bosphorus is transformed into a dazzling turquoise
item.description: The jewel-toned Bosphorus in Istanbul glowed due to phytoplankton called Emiliania huxleyi. The microscopic organisms thrive in water with high levels of sunlight.

item.title: Cat disrupts the Dean of Canterbury's sermon
item.description: Curiosity took this cat into a cassock as he disrupted one of Canterbury cathedral's morning prayer videos with a hilarious appearance that has made the video one of the cathedral's most popular.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'working on Project Birch business bailout'
item.description: Rishi Sunak is developing a business bailout package which would see the Government act as lender of 'last resort' to key UK firms to stop them from going under because of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: James Reed warns of job losses 'tsunami' on 'day of reckoning' when furlough ends
item.description: The owner of Reed has warned job losses could sweep across the country once the government's furlough scheme ends at the ends of October. More than 6m people have signed up to the scheme.
